Google has shocked it's shareholders by announcing that Eric Schmidt , it's current CEO will step down in April and co-founder Larry Page replace him in the Chief Executive Officer role. Reflecting on the Arizona shootings that killed six people and badly wounded Rep. Gabrielle Giffords , Colin Powell said he was dismayed by the harsh tenor of political debate that some have said may have contributed to the attack. There has crept in our society and our public dialogue, a coarseness, a nastiness, an attack of people who don't share the same views as you do, he said. "All sorts of nastiness. Mike Pence may have even forced the NRA's hand on whether or not to score the Senate vote on Elena Kagan . The NRA scored the vote on Sonia Sotomayor , the first time they have scored a vote on a Supreme Court justice, a score that will knock down the grades of usually-reliable Democrats like Harry Reid of Nevada. The only question was how much they drop. And although the show did drop, it still produced huge numbers easily beating all its competition. Last week's episode was actually up from last Thursday's episode by nearly 18 percent, and was down only 9 percent from the equivalent episode last year. Labour deputy leader Harriet Harman , speaking on Sky News, said: Hacking into people's phones is illegal. Obviously the criminal law has got to be complied with and if it is broken then it should be investigated by the police and it should be enforced. "Nobody is above the law, no newspaper editor, no journalist.
